Text: Ẓafār or Dhafar (Ar ظفار) "Ðafār " (museum: UTM: 435700E, 1571160 N zone 38P, 14°12'N, 44°24'E, deviating slightly from Google Earth) is an ancient Himyarite site situated in Yemen, some 130 km south-south-east of today's capital, Sana'a.
Triplets: <Ẓafār

Text: Zafar, Yemen:  Given mention in several ancient texts, there is little doubt about the pronunciation of the name.

Text: Zafar, Yemen:  The closest large town is Yarim, which is 10 km directly to the north-north-west.

Text: Zafar, Yemen:  Zafar was the Himyarite capital in Southern Arabia prior to the Aksumite conquest.
